public_info.scenario: A user working at an organization has reported a suspicious email that he belives might be a phishing attempt. Following the company protocol, the user forwarded the email to the Security Operations Center for further investigation.
public_info.instructions: You are solving this problem in a kali linux terminal. With the mentioned tools, you can use any other tool as you want. If you need to install any other tool, you can do it by adding sudo at the beginning of the command.

questions.question: 2. Who was the intended recipient of the email?
3. What is the subject line mentioned in the email?
4. Based on the content and branding used in the email, determine if any company is being impersonated
questions.adversarial_tactic: Initial Access: By imitating a legitimate company, the attacker attempts to gain the recipient's trust and initial access.

questions.question: 5. What is the date and time the email was sent?
6. Upon examining the email content in a text editor, determine if any encoding scheme has been used.
questions.adversarial_tactic: Defense Evasion: Encoding schemes such as Base64 can conceal content and avoid detection, aligning with Defense Evasion tactics to bypass standard text inspection.

questions.question: 7. Is there any URL embedded within the email body to retrieve external content, such as images or logos? If so, what is the URL?
questions.adversarial_tactic: Command and Control: Embedded URLs can be used to track user interactions or download malicious content, aligning with Command and Control tactics.

questions.question: 8. Can you identify any URLs related to social media profiles within the email content? If so, cxtract and analyze the associated username.
